cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward the middle Texas coast, then forecast to stall/meander near the coast through the weekend and drift slowly north-eastward toward Louisiana early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Corpus Christi–Port O'Connor

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch south of the Mouth of the Rio Grande to Boca de Catan, Mexico; Storm Surge Watch south of Port Mansfield, TX, to the Mouth of the Rio Grande
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning Port Mansfield to High Island, TX; Hurricane Warning Port Mansfield to Sargent, TX; Tropical Storm Warning North of Sargent to High Island, TX and south of Port Mansfield to Mouth of the Rio Grande
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast and southwest Louisiana coastline
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤11%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; brief gusts 35–40 mph possible Mon–Tue
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge 1–3 ft possible near Louisiana coast; negligible at the inland port itself
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential 5–10 inches of rain with locally higher amounts, creating significant inland and river flooding concerns around Baton Rouge
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands; prolonged river flooding due to persistent heavy rain over the Mississippi watershed
